content.description:
The following balanced equation represents the decomposition of hydrogen peroxide, <math alttext="H 2 O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>.
<math alttext="2 H 2 O 2, aqueous, reacts to produce 2 H 2 O, liquid, plus O 2, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>→</mo><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>+</mo><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math>

A student carries out an experiment in which a sample of <math alttext="H 2 O 2, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> decomposes in the presence of <math alttext="M n O 2, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi>MnO</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>s</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math>. The student measures the volume of <math alttext="O 2, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> produced by the reaction at regular intervals while the temperature is held constant. The student’s data are given in the following table.
 Time (s)Volume of <math alttext="O 2, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> Collected <math alttext="(in milliliters)" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>mL</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> <math alttext="0" display="inline" overflow="scroll" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>60</mn></math> <math alttext="42" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>42</mn></math><math alttext="120" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>120</mn></math> <math alttext="64" content.question: If <math alttext="6.0 times 10 to the negative 3 power mole" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>6.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>mol</mi></math> of <math alttext="H 2 O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> was consumed in the experiment, how many total moles of products were produced?

choices.label: <math alttext="6.0 times 10 to the negative 3 power mole" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>6.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>mol</mi></math>

<math alttext="9.0 times 10 to the negative 3 power mole" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>9.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>mol</mi></math>

<math alttext="12 times 10 to the negative 3 power mole" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>12</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>mol</mi></math>

<math alttext="18 times 10 to the negative 3 power mole" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>18</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>mol</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="9.0 times 10 to the negative 3 power mole" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>9.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>mol</mi></math>

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
